data.text:
@Simon_Says_82 @hairydel Ooh, you sexist blighter. You make a stupid comment and you got called on it  

Time of the month. 😂😂😂😂
@Simon_Says_82 @hairydel And you'd still be equally as irrelevant.
@hairydel 🧐

@BEN25485 @Pritch533 @hairydel Sadly not, only in civil law is the opposing party liable to pay the costs, as this is defined as criminal law, the costs are paid from central funds (ie revenue from taxpayers).
@nhastings81 @Nichola_Kay @hairydel Someone brighter would have possibly  googled “speeding loopholes” and worked it out themselves. All he’s done is pay idiot tax.

@Nichola_Kay @hairydel You mean he’s had someone who looked at the date his letter was sent and that person realised there was a technical error and managed to get David out of the fine. Anyone can do it, it’s only because he’s a public figure that the news got interested and created this hype
@hairydel Pretty cool that. 👍🏻

@troskinny @SeanBottomley @NatassiaJones @hairydel I knew about this years ago, it's not exactly a loophole, it's the law that the NIP has to be received within an explicit time period. So much nonsense and anger about this, it's bizarre.
@hairydel CUNT!!!!
@hairydel What a tosser eh it would of cost less too pay the fine hope he trips over & breaks a leg .

@AlexWatkins1995 @hairydel Yup, that's past the 'very unofficial' 10% margin. 30mph zones are generally policed with greater zeal because there's people about, you'd be massively unlucky to get done for doing 74 on a motorway.
@tjz1100 @hairydel 30
@Simon_Says_82 @hairydel Which will really make him sad as he's fucking Victoria on a pile of £100 notes.
@davieschp @hairydel You can get off murder on a technicality, if your brief is clued enough.
@Sefgrt @interna31146245 @hairydel It works for anyone with legal protection, and fines are calculated on income, so you might get a £100 fine, Beckham would get a bit more.
@Jayuk1977 @leapingtom @hairydel Fines are calculated on income, so it'd be a shedload more than 60 quid.
@hutch__man @hairydel Not necessarily. Get legal protection as part of your insurance or Green flag/AA/RAC membership.
@AlexWatkins1995 @hairydel 4mph over what? .5 mph over 100 will get you a ban, 4mph over 70 won't.

@NatassiaJones @hairydel I'm a 'lower class' person and I've used solicitors to successfully challenge the inept application of the law on at least 2 occasions. what did it cost? the £23 supplement to my AA membership.
@SeanBottomley @wcd07 @NatassiaJones @hairydel Then the public can Google it for themselves. Cant blame Becks for this one. It also helped raise awareness of such a loophole - for better or worse.
@hairydel Money talks
@leapingtom @hairydel He must have been close to the points limit or why else would you spend thousands on a barrister to avoid a £60 fine.

@wcd07 @NatassiaJones @hairydel Difference here is he can afford someone wjo understands the law, if the public as a whole were aware of this, how many would go down same route i wonder.
Jail time, oh my
@hairydel It was the same district judge that heard ant mcpartlins drink driving case!...

@davieschp @hairydel It's specifically for driving offences, notice of prosecution for a driving offence has to be sent within a very specific time frame if you were not stopped at the time of the offence
@hairydel He would have spent more money on the solicitor than any fine - how stupid is that? Even if he was disqualified it's not as if he can't afford a taxi ffs
@Pritch533 @hairydel If you win a court case then your costs are recovered from the other side. 👍🏻
@hairydel Even tho he admitted he was speeding,disgraceful
@Pops68868428 @hairydel Actually it's the same rule for everyone
@hairydel Expensive lawyers eh
@hairydel Wouldn't the fine of cost less than the lawyer? 🤣 https://t.co/EmyYIanPmQ
@hairydel And im getting slapped with a £100 fine and 3 points for being 4mph over
@hairydel He’ll most probably get a knighthood now? Stupid bastard upside down country. One rule for the egomaniacs etc etc...
@NatassiaJones @hairydel If it was a lower class being speeding and the fine came in a  day late, they wouldn't be doing jail time. Stop the faux outrage

@hairydel Yeah but at what cost!!...not a good example to set out kids!, A lot of people are angry he did break the law!, But money and a clever lawyer gets him off, so it appears again one law for the rich and another for the rest!, He may have won the day but he has lost credibility!👎😠

@richstone59 @hairydel NIP wasnt sent late. Sent 2 Feb & is deemed served after 2 days but @BentleyMotors claim it was received on 7 Feb as datestamped by their post room; 1 day outside the window. Do @BentleyMotors have a reason to keep 1 of their rich ambassadors sweet? Your guess is as good as mine.
@hairydel What really angers me about this is that he has knowingly used his privileged position to get himself out of a situation that he didn’t like.
@hairydel And if you’re a day late paying a fine it doubles. Rules are Rules moaning morons

@hairydel So many on here with chips on their shoulders about “class” or privilege. The Police were at fault. It’s legal challenges like this that expose faults - and by doing so bring about changes in the law to stop people getting away with stuff in the future. All lawyers do this.
@hairydel No knighthood for you sir 😂

@hairydel A good District Judge and/or Legal Advisor in court would have noticed this discrepancy and the case would have been dropped without the need for Nick Freeman to get more publicity and a big pay day
@hairydel Don’t need an expensive lawyer to realise it was a day late. Just common sense
@hairydel What a waste of time.....Beckham's an idiot.

@cyanbutterfly @hairydel Most laws have loopholes bcoz they were written by humans - a really good lawyer knows how to find these loopholes. I’m sure a lot of ppl have escaped a lot of laws thru these loopholes and no one has amended them bcoz its time consuming and probably costly and won’t work anyway
@Stormlooper77 @hairydel Bcoz you don’t know the law - if you had read up on it or got a good lawyer you would have been fine. It’s your job to sort out your defence and Beckham did that for himself

@NatassiaJones @hairydel System is not corrupt - use a good lawyer too next time. System has loopholes everywhere and you need someone good at law to take advantage - nothing to do with rich or poor ppl. Brains were distributed equally- using them is optional

@hairydel Good for him to hire a good lawyer - and even better that Nick Freeman is excellent at his job. It’s not their fault that the law has loopholes- I’m sure he isn’t the first or the last to escape thru them. Anyone bothered should look to changing the law.
@cyanbutterfly @hairydel Was just going to say it all looks a little to convenient to me.
@hairydel What a joke one rule for one ..
@hairydel Same for everyone. The letter has to be delivered within 14 days. He got lucky.
@hairydel A likely story !!!
@hairydel How much was the punishment? How much was the lawyer?
@NatassiaJones @hairydel You can't get much lower class than an East London footballer born to a hairdresser and a kitchen fitter 😂
@hairydel My letter arrived 5 months later I was still charged absolute joke of a system.

@hairydel Annoying but if that's the rules, then too bad. The authorities will have to get their act together to prevent a repeat.
Looks suspiciously like  a deliberate error to me
@NatassiaJones @hairydel Well said !!!
@rayjlyons @hairydel What a twat more like !!! This is the second time he was caught and got away with them both !!! The law is an ass !!! And so is he !!!
@NatassiaJones @hairydel You'll need to explain that one. What has class got to do with it, and show me one person that has been jailed for 59 in a 40?
@hairydel Might try that one (if I’m ever stupid enough to speed) or does that only work when you’re a celebrity?
